title: Chicago mayor slams ‘Republican cowards’ like Ted Cruz over gun laws
text:
What about Chicago?

If you’ve tuned into talk radio, chances are good you’ve heard the host or the guest (or both) deflect calls for increased gun control by pointing to Chicago as some sort of crime-ridden wasteland where disarming law-abiding citizens has directly led to a spike in shooting deaths.

Well, Ted Cruz, who once showed his love of guns by using an assault-style rifle to cook bacon, tweeted Monday that “Gun control doesn’t work. Look at Chicago” after Breitbart News reported that 25 people were shot in the “Democrat-controlled” city over the long holiday weekend.

Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot fired back:

‘Keep our name out of your mouth.’

She deployed the chart below to show that 60% of illegal firearms recovered in Chicago come from outside Illinois — “mostly from states dominated by coward Republicans like you who refuse to enact commonsense gun legislation.” (What’s more, NPR and other fact checkers have rated as false the claim that Chicago’s gun laws are the country’s strictest.)

She wasn’t finished, either:

When @tedcruz and the @gop dismiss common sense gun policies, they disrespect victims and their families, who deserve to live without pain and fear. — Lori Lightfoot (@LightfootForChi) September 3, 2019

Lightfoot, inaugurated on May 20 as successor to Rahm Emanuel, has called for stricter gun laws in response to the recent mass shootings across the country, and this isn’t the first time she’s gotten into a Twitter TWTR, -1.62% tangle in defense of her city. Last month, she took the fight to Ivanka Trump over a tweet following the El Paso and Dayton shootings whose grammatical construction rendered it highly inaccurate.
